meanings.definition: The small, precise, or trivial details of something.
meanings.sent1: She always gets lost in the minutia of planning her parties.
meanings.sent2: The professor focused on every minutia of the research project.
meanings.sent3: John's obsession with the minutia of his stamp collection is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the minutia of the flower petals in exquisite detail.
meanings.sent5: The detective noticed a crucial minutia that led to solving the case.

meanings.sent1: Don't get caught up in the minutia; focus on the big picture.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project hinged on one small minutia that was overlooked.
meanings.sent3: Sarah found herself laughing at the minutia of her cat's peculiar behavior.
meanings.sent4: The minutia of the situation seemed to fade away as the bigger issues took precedence.
meanings.sent5: The minutia of the conversation revealed more than the words spoken.
